dalersmootha3.name: Daler Rowney Smooth Heavyweight A3
dalersmootha3.notes: Excellent for crisp technical plotting. Micron: razor sharp with almost no spread. Acrylic (Molotow/Yono): dries fast on the surface and may leave a neat ridge. Overall: neutral, predictable stock.

daleraquafinehpa3.name: Daler Rowney Aquafine HP A3
daleraquafinehpa3.notes: Handles layered ink with a slight spread under heavy fills. Micron: stays crisp with tiny softening on long strokes. Acrylic: absorbs slightly more because of watercolor sizing and dries flatter.

vangoghblacka3.name: Van Gogh Black Watercolour A3
vangoghblacka3.notes: High contrast background, softer micro-lines. Micron: appears grey unless archival black; loses a bit of bite on fine grain. Acrylic: neon/opaque colours pop dramatically.

hahnemuhleharmonyhp.name: Hahnemühle Harmony Hot-Pressed 30.5×40.6cm
hahnemuhleharmonyhp.notes: Strong performer; subtle warm tone. Micron: crisp though slightly softer than premium bristol. Acrylic: smooth application with mild absorption. Ideal for sketch-line plus acrylic highlight pieces.

strathmorebristolvellum.name: Strathmore Bristol Vellum 2-ply 27.9×43.2cm
strathmorebristolvellum.notes: Outstanding for technical plotting; takes fine detail. Micron: the cleanest lines of the set. Acrylic: sits on the surface and dries bright with minimal spread. Top choice when precision matters.

hahnemuhleskizze190.name: Hahnemühle Skizze 190
hahnemuhleskizze190.notes: Great for tests and drafts. Micron: perfectly usable, slight tooth adds texture. Acrylic: heavy layers can make the sheet buckle, so keep coverage light.

cassartbristola3.name: Cass Art Bristol A3
cassartbristola3.notes: Clean, crisp lines; lighter than premium bristol. Micron: nearly Strathmore-level sharpness. Acrylic: handles light to medium coverage without issue. Good workhorse bristol.
